New Records: Sean Burke pitched two-hit ball over five innings, striking out six and walking three.
Andrew Benintendi tied his career high with his 20th homer in the game.
Key Match Events: Chicago White Sox defeated the playoff-bound Detroit Tigers 4-0, ending their six-game winning streak.
The game started 2 hours and 20 minutes late due to inclement weather.
Andrew Benintendi hit a two-run homer in the eighth inning after a leadoff walk.
Pre-Game Insights: Detroit Tigers were playoff-bound with the second or third wild card spot in the AL playoffs.
Chicago White Sox won for the fourth time in a five-game span, their season-high four straight wins from May 8-11.
Post-Match Reflections: Detroit manager A.J. Hinch expressed confidence in the team bouncing back after the loss, emphasizing the importance of the upcoming game.
Chicago White Sox extended their winning streak, staying at 121 losses heading into their final game of the season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured historical context for the Tigers, who had not reached the postseason since 2014.
Detroit's Jackson Jobe, a highly regarded 22-year-old right-hander, made his second big league appearance.
Others: The game started at 2 hours and 20 minutes late due to weather.
Chicago White Sox pitcher Jonathan Cannon was scheduled to start the final game of the season.
